p: Comparing the nutrient to carbon ratios for essential nutrients observed in a greywater, to the same ratios observed in the elemental composition of cell biomass provides an estimate as to the nutrient-balance or limitation of that greywater. Egli (2009) reports an average nitrogen to carbon ratio in generic bacterial cell biomass of 0.24 mg N/mg C. The nitrogen to carbon ratios reported in TableÂ 1 for four measured hand washing water compositions do not meet this requirement, indicating that hand washing water may be deficient in nitrogen, and warrants investigation for other nutrients as well.
